intro: Remijia marahuacensis, commonly known as the Marahuacan arrowhead, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces small, spadix-like inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found near rivers and streams. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
